page.title: 13FARM LIFE
page.content: We visited{two farms}in the area, both of which are Arable. Their crops consist of wheat,barley,mustard,sugar beet and pulses. Some wheat is bought and taken to Manningtree, Essex for malting, some is used in biscuit making at a factory in Middlesex. The sugar beet is sent to the BSC factory at Bury St.Edmunds, and the mustard is bought by Colemans of Norwich. The barley is usually used in beer making by local breweries. Both farms own various machinery, such as a Combine Harvester,tractors, fertilizer sprayers,and a cultivator. Mr. McClarty who owns the 105 acre Hall Farm is a part-time farmer and is assisted by 2 part-time labourers. Mr. Hipperson who jointly owns Wood Farm with his brother has no help at his 200 acre farm. The farmers work long hours, especially at Harvest time.
